column1:
4.5.6.5	
Thyrotropin-releasing hormone
Intravenous thyrotropin-releasing hormone (TRH) has been postulated as a neurotransmitter that induces 
urethral relaxation [553]. The exact mechanism is unclear.

Offer uroselective alpha-blockers, as an off-label option, to women with functional bladder 
outlet obstruction (BOO) following discussion of the potential benefits and adverse events.

Offer oral baclofen to women with BOO, particularly those with increased electromyography 
activity and sustained detrusor contraction during voiding.
Only offer sildenafil to women with BOO as part of a well-regulated clinical trial.
Do not offer thyrotropin-releasing hormone to women with BOO.
